subject: probability
title: Memoryless Property of Exponential Distribution
contentHtml: The exponential distribution is a fundamental concept in probability theory, and its memoryless property has significant implications.
latex: \\[X \\sim Exp(\\lambda) \\Rightarrow P(X > t | X > s) = e^{-\\lambda(t-s)}\]",
name: Memoryless Property" },
statement: \\[P(X > t | X > s) = e^{-\\lambda(t-s)} \\quad \\text{for } \\lambda > 0, t, s > 0\\]" },
intuition: The memoryless property means that the exponential distribution has no 'memory' of past events. This is in contrast to other distributions, such as the Poisson distribution, which do have a memory.
realWorldApplications: In reliability engineering, the memoryless property is used to model systems with no wear and tear.

subject: probability
title: Exponential Distribution Theorem
contentHtml: The exponential distribution is a fundamental concept in probability theory, and its memoryless property has significant implications.

theorem.statement: \[ P(X > t | X > s) = e^{-\lambda(t-s)} \] for all $t > s$
theorem.proofSketch: The proof involves showing that the memoryless property implies this result.

intuition: The exponential distribution is 'memoryless' because the probability of an event occurring at a given time only depends on the elapsed time, not on any past events.
realWorldApplications: In reliability engineering, the exponential distribution models the failure rate of components.
